I used to be one of Judges in Earth Sciences Category. The competition is for senior high school (aged 15-17).

awards.title: 1st Place International Geomapping Competition
awards.description:
It was geological mapping competition, which provided many challenges. Every team had to explore an area and build a geological map. Finally, all teams presented the map within poster in front of the field geologist-skilled judges.

IGC 2013 was held in Rembang Zone, Central Java
awards.issuer: Geological Engineering Department, Universitas Gadjah Mada

awards.title: Special Award Intel International Science and Engineering Fair
awards.description:
I brought the project about an investigation of the unique deflection of Opak River mouth. It also explained the pattern for all river mouths in Southern Coast of Central Java, Indonesia.

Intel ISEF 2011 was held in Los Angeles, California
awards.issuer: China Association for Science and Technology

awards.title: 1st Place National Youth Competition of Science Project (LKIR)
awards.description: The project was similar to the materials I brought in Intel ISEF since the competition was an affiliated national selection to be finalist in the Intel ISEF.

awards.title: Bronze Medal of National Science Olympiad (OSN)
awards.description:
I was the 27th position in Earth Science Category: Geology and Geophysics, Meteorology and Climatology, Astronomy, and Hydrology within Oceanography.

OSN 2009 was held in Jakarta and Bogor, Indonesia
awards.issuer: Ministry of Education and Culture, Republic of Indonesia

awards.title: Gold Medal National Youth Competition of Research (LPIR)
awards.description:
I presented the research about historical investigation of Ranggawarsitas's famous manuscript titled "Serat Kalatidha". Some may say that the poem is a prediction about today's human condition but I have different conclusion. The script purely told the situation when Ranggawarsita lived. Whereas the similarity with now become a new thinking that the human behavior from Ranggawarsita's time to right now is never changed.

LPIR 2009 was held in Jakarta, Indonesia
awards.issuer: Ministry of Education and Culture, Republic of Indonesia

projects.title: Investigating the eruption of Lawu Volcano
projects.description: Investigating and predicting the eruption of Lawu Volcano. The results could explain the history and the possibility of eruption.

projects.title: Excursion of Regional Geology 2016
projects.description:
Understanding the regional concept of geology in the western East Java Province.
- Southern Mountain (Pre-Cenozoic metamorphic basement)
- Kendeng (Miocene flysch-like tuffaceous sandstone)
- Randublatung (Cenozoic active mud volcano)
- Rembang (Miocene "clean" sandstone, the reservoir of Northeast Java Petroleum System)
- Lasem (Quartenary fluvio-volcanic sandstone)

projects.title: GEOSBOX : Geology Education Sandbox
projects.description:
GEOSBOX : Geology Education Sandbox.
This is an interactive learning instrument for geology. This instrument design based on Augmented Reality Sandbox by Oliver Kreylos from UC Davis. The team develop the prototype to make a wider use, such as an analogue model for structural geology and topographic change that controlled by tectonics.

profile_positions.title: Lecturer of Department of Geological Engineering

profile_positions.description:
Sekolah Ilmuwan Minangkabau (School for Scientists in Minangkabau) facilitates students to learn sciences and research. We promote the local wisdom as unlimited stocks for great ideas. Letting them to pick up their daily problems, do research, and present the solution. 

The school is made by a collaboration between Gerakan Indonesia Emas and Yayasan Baabussalam Hasdar.
profile_positions.title: Founder and Former Principal

profile_positions.description:
The main vision of GIE is to elevate the youth in sciences in every corner of Indonesia.
Project GIE#1 - Bukittinggi, 2015
Project GIE#2 - Padang, 2018
Project GIE#3 - Padang, 2019
Project GIE#4 - Agam, 2019
profile_positions.title: Founder and Mentor of Earth Sciences

profile_positions.description:
Sagasitas Scientific Journal and Research Center is a scientific community for the pre-college student (aged 12-18) that has been developed by the Department of Education, Daerah Istimewa Yogyakarta since 2005. I strengthen the community by majoring Earth Sciences and facilitate the student who has a research interest in Geology.

http://www.sagasitas.org/
